geneVariantDescriptions.description: NOTCH1 P2462fs results in a change in the amino acid sequence of the Notch1 protein beginning at aa 2462 of 2555, likely resulting in premature truncation of the functional protein (UniProt.org). P2462fs has not been characterized, however, due to the effects of other PEST domain deletions downstream of P2462 (PMID: 16614245, PMID: 16738328), P2462fs is predicted to lead to activation of Notch1 signaling and is associated with increased copy number of the NOTCH1 gene in patient tumor samples (PMID: 25564152).

references.title: Activating NOTCH1 mutations predict favorable early treatment response and long-term outcome in childhood precursor T-cell lymphoblastic leukemia.
PEST domain mutations in Notch receptors comprise an oncogenic driver segment in triple-negative breast cancer sensitive to a γ-secretase inhibitor.
Leukemia-associated mutations within the NOTCH1 heterodimerization domain fall into at least two distinct mechanistic classes.

molecularProfiles.profileName: ERBB2 neg ESR1 neg NOTCH1 P2462fs PGR neg
